reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Contribution to the Implementation of National TB Control Program towards Zero TB in the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea and Targeting Investment to Eliminate Malaria in the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea

description.narrative: Korea (Democratic Peoples Republic) - Multicomponent - United Nations Children's Fund - UNICEF. This program has the following goals: To end the TB epidemic in DPRK, indicated by a reduction of incidence of 50% by 2025, and 80% by 2030 (compared to the result of the National TB Prevalence Survey 2015/2016). To completely interrupt local transmission of Malaria across the country by 2022. The objectives of this program are: Scale up services for diagnosis of TB to achieve case detection rate of 95% with the baseline identified by results of National TB Prevalence Survey. Ensure the quality of services for TB treatment and maintain a treatment success rate of more than 90%. Expand access to drug resistant TB diagnosis and treatment services to reach more than 90% of newly occurring MDR-TB cases by 2021, and achieve treatment success rate of at least 70%. Engage with civil society, NGOs, key affected populations (including children), and other health programs for TB prevention, care and control, and ensure the sustainability of the existing social protection measures to mitigate the financial burden of TB affected families. Strengthen research and innovations for scientifically backing up TB control. Reduce number of indigenous malaria cases nationwide as compared with 2016 baseline value (5,113 cases). Reduce API <1 case per 1000 population in Ris that were at high transmission settings in 2016 (617 high risk Ris). Eliminate malaria from Ri level areas in which malaria was transmitted in 2016; baseline value (1,575 low risk Ris + 617 high risk Ris = Total 2,192 Ris). Prevent re-establishment of malaria in all Ri level areas that had malaria potential or were malaria free in 2016

receiver-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria
The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at public sector health facilities
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Percentage of malaria foci fully investigated and classified
Percentage of confirmed cases fully investigated and classified
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified

Percentage of laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance for smear microscopy among the total number of laboratories that undertake smear microscopy during the reporting period
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
M&E OTHER-1: Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to at-risk populations through mass campaigns
Proportion of households in targeted areas that received Indoor Residual Spraying during the reporting period
